title: Moment man in boxers tries to fight off car burglars with stick in Welling south east London
text:
This is the moment a man dressed in his boxer shorts and a T-shirt tried to fight off two car thieves with a stick in the middle of the night.

CCTV footage from Tiago Moreira's driveway in Welling, south east London, shows two hooded men break into his house and emerge four minutes later with a set of car keys.

They climb into the family's £20,000 Volkswagen Golf, but before they can getaway Mr Moreira, 34, dashes out in just his nightwear brandishing a large stick.

He grapples with the pair before they manage to drive off.

The car was found abandoned seven miles away in Ilford, east of the capital, but no arrests have been made.

Mr Moreira told the Evening Standard he was upstairs asleep with his wife Leonor and their seven-year-old son.

But when lights began flashing outside the window, he ran downstairs and grabbed whatever he could find - a stick used to open the loft.

He told the paper: 'I didn't think really, I just picked up the metal stick we use to open the loft door.'

'The passenger looked surprised, and acted like he was trying to say something but he just let out this strange yelp as they drove off.'

Mr Moreira's wife, who is originally from Portugal and works in childcare, believes someone had been watching the house.

The 39-year-old said: 'You think it won't happen to you but they could have hurt all of us.'

A Met Police spokesman said: 'Police were called to reports of a burglary in Edison Grove at 2am.

'Officers attended and a 34-year-old man informed them that his car had been stolen by suspects who had entered his house and took his car keys before making off.

'The car was later found abandoned in Ilford and recovered by police.'
